CROSSING THE BAY
Silverdale has become the starting point for the cross-bay walks to Grange-over-sands and Kents Bank. These walks take place at fortnightly intervals during the summer months depending on tidal conditions. Walkers are not encouraged to undertake the journey on their own as the Bay has shifting areas of treacherous quicksand. Organised parties are led by the official Guide to the Sands. Mr. Robinson, the Guide, always attempts the walk the day before leading a party. The crossing takes between two and three hours and the party is often several hundred strong and has an almost Biblical appearance.
